verbatim_example: It's been just over a week without bupe.
My thinking is still foggy from the Kratom, but it doesn't do much in regards to anxiety. Right now I imagine that the benzo W/Ds are still most of it,
I didn't sleep for a 4 day span in the past 2 weeks. I get so easily over-whelmed, and that feeling is really magnified when I stop dosing.
I only sleep hour stints, last week I was up for 4 days straight. Everything bothers me, my place is trashed from not doing crap for months...
I thought the benzo withdrawals kicked in that first week but now that I look back I think it was primarily opiate withdrawals.
The withdrawal was really intense, I was stuck to my apartment for almost the entire 3 weeks.
I'd usually take 2 and snort a half of one for a fast, hard come up and a pretty long high.
I am in the thick of wd.
The wrestless legs still won't quit.
Now that I am clean, I can barely get out of bed bc back and knees are so bad. ... cluster headaches...
I am scared bc I know I will want to use.
I am happy to be here, sober .
Every year, Ive celebrated by getting as high as possible. Not this year. I celebrated by not using.
I have been taking kratom since Tuesday to help withdrawal.
Still have the morning GI lingering around but the malaise is still the biggest pain in the ass.
I still blow up the bathroom in the morning but it doesn't persist all day.
I get these random flashes of old feelings that shoot through me for a few seconds-minutes. I try to slow down in those moments to actually feel some shit.

I still feel a bit off this morning but nothing like I did for that hour or two yesterday. Managed 5-6 hours of sleep after a good meal late in the evening. I have a small headache still (I think from the two sides of my brain battling it out), lingering anxiety and just feel over revved.
Yesterday went pretty well other than a few cases of the clammy sweats.
Yesterday was okay minus a crazy afternoon episode of the sweats. I fuckin hate that feeling.
Symptoms at 3 weeks out... broken sleep of 4-6 hours, morning shits (a very zen one this morning at least), anhedonia waves, come and go restless limbs.
Sunday morning the fog rolled back in. Emotional, tons of GI issues, anxiety sweats, depressed, stir crazy, irritable, restless. Felt like day 4 of withdrawals out of the blue.
This was the day of the month I would get my script refilled and normally start the process of one GREAT week followed by the cycle of withdrawal etc etc.
can't sleep. but I'm happy I've gone this long.
I've now gone five days without
Got lots of benzos just in case.
I was so fucked up on dope and xanax and kpins that i blacked out the entire way.
I had a major car accident and relapsed. In back to 3days.

The day I ran out I called in sick, since it had been so long since I'd experienced WD I was in absolutel agony, I literally layed in the shower crying for like 12 hours, every inch of my body hurt, migraines, sweating like a dog even though my condo was 62 degrees, throwing up, I was so tired but couldn't even lay on my bed because the RLS would start up instantly.
I'm going to get totally straight hamstered!

I bought some Kratom, and have some muscle relaxers for the withdrawl I may experience. But, truth be told - my withdrawl isn't anywhere near what I've seen in others. Bone pain and exhaustion is about it.

They gave me a cortisone shot and said it would take a few days to feel some relief and this morning I woke up feeling a lot better in that area, so I don't have a reason to take anymore. ... Having him hide them, and have to administer them has kept me from chewing the whole bottle and that really is pathetic.
withdrawal is very similar to the flu... I wonder if this situation would make it ‚Äúeasier‚Äù both physically and mentally, since you know you are going to feel that way regardless of using or not.
Damn I snifee 5 bags n I an noddin outüòûf .
I am struggling atm. Depression is a big struggle and i just want to numb everything out.
Im sick of feeling like crap, throwing up, being depressed
I been in the bathroom all day puking and shitting. When i try to eat or drink liquids all i do is puke them back up.
I am still in hospital they said they'll be discharging me tomorrow or the next day.
"Must Not Sleep‚Ä¶ must warn others"- I got this cause to me it's about staying self aware and in the moment which is a huge part of recovery and growing as a person.
I could drown in self pity which leads to getting loaded, but really that solves nothing except feeling good for two hours and being back on the hamster wheel of addiction.

Today I‚Äôve got 90 days. 90 days ago I was sitting in the IOP program at the Betty Ford Center stung out of my mind with twenty dollars in my pocket anxiously waiting for it to be over that day so that my friend and I could go score yet again.
Have almost 15 days clean now and I notice recovery has been getting harder and harder for me the more i relapse.
I'm currently finishing up my fifth day sober-ish (on xanax rn) and through the worst of the physical WDs.
Today Junky Jesus screws me over by turning up 4x oxy 80mg's. I had no urge to buy today, but as soon as I had the pills in front of me I broke.

I've been desperately trying anything and everything that I think might give me a rush... Masturbating. Weed. Listening to music. Popping insane amounts of gabapentin. They all just leave me wanting more.
I wish. I'm three weeks clean and have found no happiness or clarity in sobriety. All I want is a bump. All I want is to be numb.
yesterday I was feeling extremely depressed, sweating, cold, jittery/RLS, classic mild WDs
I feel that going through the withdrawals combined with not having any crutches will give me some enlightenment
This is what I did before I sold my studio for opiates 3 years ago.
So last weekend my original dude calls me. I was like fuck yeah and we went through the whole long process of back and forth trying to figure out when to meet.
Currently working on an immodium taper, because I cannot deal with the vomiting, which I get REALLY bad during w/ds.
Every day, no tolerance breaks, just a few accidental withdrawals when FEDEX fucked up lol.
Had real bad nausea last night, wasn't really anywhere near puking just, felt queasy. And I was wide awake until ~6am when I got REAL tired.
I have like 3 out of 10 nausea all day and haven't had a solid movement in 10 days(used Lope taper to quit.)
I have the worst headache of my life achey and chilly, when I'm not feeling on fire.
I could feel the neurons in my reward center start firing.  After ~3 seconds where I almost started salivating and sneezing(I sneeze when I get high for some reason)
It's like ice picks in my brain. The pain is incredible. ... my HEAD is like a balloon filled with shards of glass.
I'm also ice cold, is that a withdrawal thing? Cloudy head and jumpy jittery chicken sizzle muscles
End of day seven, goddamn bastard 14-hour workday is done... Bye-bye Egghead U, I'm going the hell home to a bath (my back!) and some sleep.
It's the kind of day I used to deal with by taking a handful of pills, so things wouldn't bug me so much.
I ate through half a box of crackers and two apples, some cheese, and I can't stop drinking water. It's like my body WANTS to get better now.
My body went through an absolute horror show of pain. Fever, shakes, nausea, muscle cramps... insomnia, jesus.
By the time the conversation was over I wanted to be drunk or high, god I was frustrated.
Handling a bad headache with something other than an opiate makes me feel stronger.
We never used together but we were both hopeless dope fiends at the same time but never talked.
I had ruined a lot of relationships and was on the brink of losing my job. I was addicted to heroin again after my first stint in rehab got me almost 6 months of sobriety.
This shit takes the withdrawals away but it is almost not even worth it. Sometimes I can do half a bag or 2 bags before I go bat shit insane.
I haven't used since the day but the cravings have been there 24/7.

It looks like a "heroin rash" from what Google images tells me but I haven't used in around 3 weeks and it only appeared around the time the h would have been leaving my system so I'm not sure if there's any correlation.
I kicked my h habit about 3 weeks ago and haven‚Äôt had the urge to use more than every now and then since
I've recently quit heroin my tolerance is pretty low.
I am currently on my 4th day off of 120-150mg or oxy daily.
when you feel you need to get out at moments of clarity and joy let it happen to let the Trick know what they have been missing. It doesn't have to be 24hr lockdown after the initial withdrawls.
I can tell the difference. Gotta keep my mind focused.
Crawling my ass out of bed is easier.
Oh yeah and the man that owns this hotel has offered to take me back and forth for work this week.
I can't go more than 6 hours without starting to become sick.

I was in brutal pain and going through withdrawals such as the tingling sensations.
I never get withdrawals; I use to but got past the worst of my addiction and now I only use two times a week give or take a day.
I have been for about 6 years everyday.
Lope definitely helped my withdrawals the first three days and then when I woke up on the 4th day, I felt completely fine.

Starting all over now. Day 3. My withdrawals are never really that bad besides the sleep problem but I just take two extremely high doses of loperamide each 48 hours apart and before I know it i'm clear of the withdrawals
I woke up frantically and call everybody trying to find someone to rip off or some way to score.
I have meditated on and off, usually when I had a steady supply of heroin. Was doing a bundle a day but now im 24 days clean
Well my dog started barking, and unbeknownst to me there was a duck frozen completely to the ground with a broken beak frantically trying to escape.
I remember endless aching Timeless nights spent sleepless, taking anything to stop the shaking,
I started becoming sick more often and wanted to die. Losing jobs left and right.
I have thousands of dollars in dept, and honestly I am so scared of withdrawls that I am unable to do anything but work, go home and try to hit somewhere,
I am 13 hours into this hell, so that is a good start. My girlfriend is using several times a day right next to me, so I need some help resisting to ask her for some.
my eyes are watering like I‚Äôm almost crying for no reason so thats fun.

I went to buy a bag, but my dude know we trying to stop putting money in his pocket so the mf gives me four bags for free, cool dude, right? No, cuz now I‚Äôm going back to buy 10 more because those four bags put us back a hell of a lot and we are not ready to start all over.
They make the W 80% better, I am at day 3 of W but it feels like day 1.
The problem tho is that I have had mild withdrawals after that. How is that even possible?

Can‚Äôt stand it so I texted my best friend from the phone i hid in my boxer lol, currently waiting for him to find someone that can take out cash cuz he lost his card, then go score and make a shoot for me

Being clean is hard but if I keep it up mabye some day I won‚Äôt have to keep fighting the urge to use or to kill myself.

The only withdraw symptom that's still bad right now is the sleep. Still having trouble staying asleep for longer than 4 hours.
I'm finally over the physical withdraws, which is great.

My dealer always told me if I ever wanted to quit he would completely cut me off and I finally gave him the word and he completely cut me off lol. ... These ideas always sound so great when your high as a kite lol but now that I‚Äôm in the thick of it I want to shoot myself
Obviously the PAWS just makes it worse buts it‚Äôs been a problem my whole life that I have not been able to conquer and has really held me back in life.
today I woke up around the same time and woke up sweaty with chills and hot flashes

we are trying to figure out what we need to look into over the weekend, despite losing it all I am glad I can say we don't have to worry about where money will come and trying to get through each day without having to WD

verbatim_example: I finally got off of dope using a sub taper. Coming up on 6 months clean from heroin/fent.
I am finding it extremely overwhelming that I have to work 40 hours a week & simultaneously go through opiate withdrawal.
When we try to kick the habit, we become physically ill. (Albeit cruel & unusual punishment for taking a step in the right direction)
This song describes what I feel during WD, in a round-about way. Especially the part where he says "cold as can be".
These past two weeks have probably been the hardest I've ever lived through but I've also never felt stronger.
Over the past month, I couldn't take a damn nap to save my life.
I can't imagine being out in the rain or snow and experiencing withdrawal, praying that someone will come through or that you can scrounge up enough money to pick up and not be sick.
I went through the WD, chills/sweating, upset stomach, yawning, dilated pupils, sneezing, crazy anxiety, insomnia.
This is the last time I will go through this.
My eyes are watering and I'm sneezing... Got the crippling sadness today. I am super overwhelmed with not using.
I'm finally over the worst of WD
The only thing stopping me from relapsing is my cousin.

I'm shaking; my body feels like I'm dying.
I went 9 days straight fucked up basically all day.
